question.questionText: Elena has a male lizard that has lived for several years in the habitat she provided. She knows that some lizards are territorial. Besides additional food and water, what should she be sure to include in the habitat before she adds another male lizard?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Elena should include a separate shelter for each lizard.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Elena should add shelter.
She needs shelter.
Elena has to put homes inside of the habitat.
She needs to add another house or shelter and maybe a female.
Elena should include another home.
More shelter.
Put a glass in the center of the tank.
Get her own shelter for that lizard.
A lizard needs food, home, space, air, water.
A structure for the next lizard.
Elena should make special places for both of them otherwise they will fight.
Maybe she could put in 2 females also.
A new bed.
Some twigs, rocks and air.
I think she would need to put some wood need some wood.
Maybe some shelter or some grass.
She would have to know the food the lizards want.
She is going to need food for both of them, water, space and shelter.
She needs to observe her lizard.
Some leaves and some wood.
Water and food.
Another shelter.
The shelter and other basic needs.
She should add another shelter.
Well, food, water, some leaves, some dirt, a stick or 2 and some rocks and grass.
Elena should put leaves, logs, and tree branches in the habitat.
She should get a bigger and food and water.
Elena should put more food and water.
She should add shelter and space.
Elena should be sure to have either 2 habitats or a lot of space so each lizard does not have to fight over space.
She should put a prop of a lizard to see if her lizard will let it be or fight it.
Grass.
She should make sure they are nice to each other.
Shelter, space, and homes.
Another house for the lizard.
She or he should add more space and almost everything lizards need.
